parts.text: {"word":"arriviste","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"成り上がり者、新興成金、野心家","english_definition":"a person who has recently reached a position of power or wealth, especially one who is ruthless or unscrupulous.","examples":[{"sentence":"He was seen as an arriviste by the established members of the club.","translation":"彼はクラブの古参メンバーから成り上がり者と見なされていた。"},{"sentence":"The novel satirizes the arrivistes who flocked to the city in search of fortune.","translation":"その小説は、富を求めて街に群がった成り上がり者たちを風刺している。"},{"sentence":"She dismissed her rival as a mere arriviste, lacking the proper breeding and connections.","translation":"彼女はライバルを、適切な家柄や人脈を欠いた、ただの成り上がり者だと切り捨てた。"}],"collocations":["social arriviste","political arriviste","cultural arriviste"],"synonyms":["upstart","parvenu","nouveau riche","climber","social climber"],"antonyms":["aristocrat","established member","old money","blue blood"],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"The term 'arriviste' carries a negative connotation, suggesting that the person's success is due to ambition and opportunism rather than merit or talent. It is often used to criticize those who are perceived as lacking the social graces or cultural refinement of those who were born into wealth or power.","priority":"★★★"}],"etymology":{"value":"From French 'arriviste,' from 'arriver' (to arrive), ultimately from Latin 'adripare' (to come to shore). The sense of someone who has 'arrived' in society, especially in a sudden or opportunistic way, developed in the 19th century.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌærɪˈviːst/","syllables":"ar-ri-viste"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"arrivistes"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He is a arrive.","correct":"✓ He is an arriviste.","note":"'Arriviste' is the correct noun form. 'Arrive' is a verb."},{"incorrect":"✗ She acted very arriviste.","correct":"✓ She acted like an arriviste.","note":"'Arriviste' is a noun, not an adjective. Use 'like an arriviste' or rephrase."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":[],"idioms_phrases":[]},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C2","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"'Arriviste' is a relatively uncommon word used to describe someone who has recently gained wealth or power and is often seen as ambitious or ruthless in their pursuit of success. It often carries a negative connotation, implying a lack of sophistication or social grace. Understanding this word requires a good grasp of social dynamics and nuanced vocabulary."}, "example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The play is a scathing critique of the arrivistes who dominate the city's art scene.","translation":"その劇は、街の芸術界を支配する成り上がり者たちに対する痛烈な批判である。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"成り上がり者"},{"sentence":"He was determined to prove that he was more than just an arriviste.","translation":"彼は自分がただの成り上がり者以上であることを証明しようと決意していた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"成り上がり者"},{"sentence":"The old aristocracy looked down on the new arrivistes with disdain.","translation":"旧貴族は、新しい成り上がり者たちを軽蔑の目で見ていた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"成り上がり者"}]}
